title: Apple Harvest Pound Cake with Caramel Glaze
directions: Beat the sugar, oil, vanilla and eggs together in a large bowl until light and fluffy using an electric mixer.
In a separate bowl, mix together the flour, baking soda, cinnamon and salt and mix with the batter until well combined.
With a spoon, mix in the apples and walnuts and pour the batter in a greased 9 inch bundt pan.
In a preheated oven to 350° bake for 1 hour and 20 minutes.
Let the cake cool in the pan for 20 minutes before transferring it into a wire rack to cool completely.
In a small saucepan, heat the butter, milk and brown sugar over medium heat and bring to a boil stirring constantly.
Drizzle the glaze over the warm cake and voila!
Easy, peasy and yummy! This is one of my favorite cakes! The apples, walnuts and caramel glaze make this pound cake so special. Give it a shot, and let me know what you think.
ingredients: 2 medium, peeled, cored and chopped Granny Smith apples.
½ cup of butter or margarine.
